channel.title: GTX460 winrar
channel.description:
Newegg (USD) GTX460: 199$ HD5770: 150$ HD5850: 300$
I'm a computer enthusiast who likes value for money, ATI have had it for quite a while now, but not anymore.
Why should you pick the GTX460?
GTX460 is a huge overclocker GTX460 when overclocked runs on par with 5850 (beats 5870/GTX470 in some games) GTX460 sucks less power than the 5850 (even when OC'd) GTX460 runs cooler than the 5850 (even when OC'd) GTX460 has less noise than the 5770/5850 Nvidia provides better better drivers than ATI Nvidia scales better in SLI, than ATI with CrossFire GTX460 has CUDA GTX460 has PhysX GTX460 makes better usage of DX11 (tessellation performs better than ATI) GTX460 has 3D Vision GTX460 is 100$ (33%) less than the 5850
Some other things i have seen, is SLI 460s (400$) beat the 5970(700$), and on par (or a few percent lower) than 2x 5870s in Crossfire (800$)
Being about 50$ more than the 5770, and not only being a MUCH faster card, it also has all the features above, which i think this makes the GTX460 the new card to recommend people
It's about time nvidia fix fermi!
Benchmarks: http://www.anandtech.com/show/3809/nvidias-geforce-gtx-460-the-200-king/1

item.title: GTX460 winrar
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Also what about the people who want a single card and not run SLI. Im sure its easy to beat the price of a single card running two lesser cards in sli, but it takes alot more to put all of that technology in one slot. A couple years from now they are going to have to rip both of those cards out just to upgrade instead if they bought the 5970 they could probably just buy another and put it in crossfire.

Read full topic

item.title: GTX460 winrar
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:3, topic:348555”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=444934.msg3266984#msg3266984 date=1278933369]
ATi tried too hard, nVidia have always been the better cards.
[/quote]
What do you mean tried to hard? Isn’t that what they’re supposed to do? Try hard in order to beat competition? They had the better deals, variety and price vs performance from september 09 till now. ATI for once in the last few years been a good competitor for NVIDIA in both quality, performance and commercial success.

I’m glad NVIDIA sorted their shit out though, the 460 looks great. Hopefully this forces ATI to put the cards back down to what they originally launched them at now that they have proper competition.[/quote]I completely agree with you. My ATI Radeon 5970 was worth every penny.

Read full topic

;D Because the 460’s are new. Once again nvidia is better than ATI.
[/quote]once again? this don’t come around often these days.

2x GTX460s in SLI for 400$ is unbeatable, check out it’s sli scaling and overclocking ability: http://www.guru3d.com/article/geforce-gtx-460-sli-review/1[/quote]

Wow they really owned the 5970…Well not in every game but in mw2 they did 30fps more than the 5970 which is good considering they cost half the price of a 5970.

item.title: GTX460 winrar
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Newegg (USD)
GTX460: 199$
HD5770: 150$
HD5850: 300$

I’m a computer enthusiast who likes value for money, ATI have had it for quite a while now, but not anymore.

Why should you pick the GTX460?

GTX460 is a huge overclocker
GTX460 when overclocked runs on par with 5850 (beats 5870/GTX470 in some games)
GTX460 sucks less power than the 5850 (even when OC’d)
GTX460 runs cooler than the 5850 (even when OC’d)
GTX460 has less noise than the 5770/5850
Nvidia provides better better drivers than ATI
Nvidia scales better in SLI, than ATI with CrossFire
GTX460 has CUDA
GTX460 has PhysX
GTX460 makes better usage of DX11 (tessellation performs better than ATI)
GTX460 has 3D Vision
GTX460 is 100$ (33%) less than the 5850

Some other things i have seen, is SLI 460s (400$) beat the 5970(700$), and on par (or a few percent lower) than 2x 5870s in Crossfire (800$)

Being about 50$ more than the 5770, and not only being a MUCH faster card, it also has all the features above, which i think this makes the GTX460 the new card to recommend people

It’s about time nvidia fix fermi!

Benchmarks: http://www.anandtech.com/show/3809/nvidias-geforce-gtx-460-the-200-king/1

Read full topic
